sentence.Network_en: She shared her daughter's disdain for her fellow countrymen.
sentence.Network_cn: 她和女儿都瞧不起自己的同胞。

sentence.Network_en: Janet looked at him with disdain.

雅思英语完整版_馆档网 ... discriminate 区别，区分；岐视 disdain 蔑视, 轻视 disguise 假扮；隐蔽；掩饰.
蔑字的解释---在线新华字典 ... 细小;轻微〖 slight〗 轻视;轻侮。亦作“懱”〖 disdain;despise〗 灭,消灭〖 extinguish;obliterate〗.
词根联想记忆法词汇教程(三)|联想记忆法背单词 ... discrimination n. 歧视 disdain v. 轻视，不屑；n.轻蔑 disfigure v. 破坏.

list.abs: the wife disdains say : your where when so had roused !妻子不屑的说：你哪儿什么时候这么鼓过！
Appreciate those who disdained you , because he awaked your amour - propre ., 感激蔑视你的人 , 因为他觉醒了你的自尊.
I disdained to answer his rude remarks ., 我不屑回答他的粗话.
I disdain all of you peons !, 我鄙视你们这些苦力!

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French desdeign (noun), desdeignier (verb), based on Latin dedignari, from de- (expressing reversal) + dignari 'consider worthy' (from dignus 'worthy')

entry.def: If you feel disdain for someone or something, you dislike them because you think that they are inferior or unimportant.

example.ex: Janet looked at him with disdain...
She shared her daughter's disdain for her fellow countrymen.
example.tran: 她和女儿都瞧不起自己的同胞。

entry.def: If you disdain someone or something, you regard them with disdain.

example.ex: Jackie disdained the servants that her millions could buy.
example.tran: 杰姬鄙视那些她用钱就可以收买的奴仆。

entry.def: If you disdain to do something, you do not do it, because you feel that you are too important to do it.

example.ex: Franklin told Sara that he had himself disdained to take the job.
example.tran: 富兰克林告诉萨拉他不屑于去做那份工作。

means.word_mean: 1. lack of respect accompanied by a feeling of intense dislike;

sentences.sentence: "the despite in which outsiders were held is legendary"

means.word_mean: 2. a communication that indicates lack of respect by patronizing the recipient

sentences.sentence: "He despises the people he has to work for"
"The professor scorns the students who don't catch on immediately"

auth_sentence.content: But not so much as your disdain for facts.

auth_sentence.content: Gadbois turned away from his plate with calm disdain.

sentences.en: A great man should disdain flatterers.
sentences.cn: 伟大的人物应鄙视献媚者。

means.word_mean: 不屑于做, 不愿意做

sentences.en: I would certainly disdain to live in such tiny flats.
sentences.cn: 我当然不愿意住在这样小的单元房里。

jushi.english: He curled his lips in disdain.
